data.text: Is the Trek 520 a Good Choice for a Touring Bike?
Is trek 520 a good choice? touring bike less than 1700usd dollars? (Choice regarding price range and quality) or what would be an alternative bicycle do you suggest? Thank you.
I’m sure the 520 is a good choice, this is my Trek 920 which is awesome, more expensive than the 520 though.
data.author: Dave Thompson

data.text: almost the same as the 920 best touring bike yet
data.author: David Odell

data.text: , nice, which model is this one?
data.author: Dave Thompson

data.text: 920
data.author: David Odell

data.text: Which they don't make anymore but if you can find the frameset which I heard they're still making you should get it
data.author: David Odell

data.text: oh right, never seen that colour, am just about to fit Jones loop bars on mine, although I think the drops look good I don’t find them comfortable if on the bike for several hours.
data.author: Dave Thompson

data.text: I painted the bike
data.author: David Odell

data.text: check the frame fit for you before you spend any money. drop bars are a kind of extension on the reach, straight handlebars are closer to your chest and the jones is curvy which makes it even closer.
data.author: Jo En Pausa

data.text: yes thanks, I already find the 920 with drops to be extremely long for me, I’m laying way forward, of course, I understand this could be changed with a shorter stem, but I’m fitting the Jones for comfort and better control on the rougher ground. I’ve seen somebody do exactly this with his 920 and it worked really well for him.
data.author: Dave Thompson

data.text: your choice might be to go straight handlebar + Ergon GP1 grips with long curvy horns. I find them really comfy for long rides. here below are cheap grips I had to grab in Bangkok but the horns are just perfect.
data.author: Jo En Pausa

data.text: Wanted a 920 but I was 1 year too late ... Hard to find aftermarket.
data.author: Peter Lehman

data.text: yes, I only learned recently that they are no longer made.....I believe you can still buy the frame and build your own.
data.author: Dave Thompson

data.text: yes, I have some flat bars with Ergon grips on my Boardman hybrid. comfortable enough, and at least the horns give a choice of a different hand position. for my 920 it was either gonna be Butterfly bars or Jones and although the Jones are expensive I got some on an eBay auction, the person had bought them two years ago to fit a certain bike, Covid hit and their plans changed.
data.author: Dave Thompson

data.text: Woo team 920! Not too many of them around. I have the 2016 in Matte Olive (good) with the bar-end shifters (less good). It has served me incredibly well over the years as a tourer, commuter, daily driver, roadie, trail bike, bench, backrest, pillow, and clothes rack.
data.author: Greg McChesney

data.text: Yes, I think so too. I opted to rebuild my 1986 Specialized Expedition (Miyata 1000 clone). No regrets. (I had actually decided on a Kona Sutra but they were sold out. This was in November 2020 and I wanted a 2021.)
data.author: Peter Lehman

data.text: excellent, I think they’re a great bike, they roll along so good, and have good racks.
data.author: Dave Thompson

data.text: For me, trek 520 and Fuji touring are the best value for money for a touring bike, Got the Fuji myself, and I like it equally to my much more expensive Koga world traveller
data.author: Thomas Madsen

data.text: The Trek 520 is a classic. It’s been updated, and it’s actually better and cheaper than ever!
data.author: Sam Reich

data.text: , It's the oldest continuously produced bicycle in Trek's lineup. I have a '93 model and it has served me well. About the only thing original on it at this point in time is the frame. No matter what, things wear out or alternative options have been my modifications,
data.author: Bill Bacon

data.text: I had a 1994. Green metallic with gold highlights. LX gear set. I tricked it up with Brooks saddle, bar tape, racks, Nitto stem, etc. I loved it but sold it when I built my Thorn Nomad.
data.author: Sam Reich

data.text: I owned it for 20 years. This is what it looked like when I sold it.
data.author: Sam Reich

data.text: LOTS of happy folks on 520s out there!
data.author: Mark Dante

data.text: Seems like a good bike for that money. Steel. 36 spokes. Very beautiful colour too. Not sure what Trek was thinking when they did the 920 and 1120 with 28 spokes only. They were probably not thinking at all. Shame they did not continue with the 520-way of thinking.
data.author: Lars Bengtsson

data.text: I have a 520 (and I used to work at trek!). It's an excellent choice, especially if you're looking at mostly paved riding. But be sure to carefully inspect the actual bike you'll be buying because we had a tendency to receive wonky frames from the factory that made brake and derailleur setups inconsistent
data.author: Greg De Salaberry Seljak

data.text: It's one of the best choices if you have in mind what it was made for. In rough ways, the 920 is a better choice, for even worse terrain the 1120 is better than 920 and so on till you hit a fat bike.
data.author: Jo En Pausa

data.text: Fuji touring is an excellent choice with some little changes (pedals, tires and saddle).
data.author: Carlos Rodríguez

data.text: Same features as other much more expensive touring bikes (Sutra, Hobootleg, etc)
data.author: Carlos Rodríguez

data.text: Trek 520 is another excellent choice also
data.author: Carlos Rodríguez

data.text: Packing to fly to & from tours Often? not locked in on 'a touring bike' has to have big wheels?
data.author: Robert Clark

data.text: Check availability. According to a local shop, there are zero new Trek 520’s available right now, and he searched across the entire 180 store inventory. Apparently, Trek paused production of the 520 to deal with part shortages. Interested to hear if anyone knows more about this.
data.author: Phil Wax

data.text: Just got a Surly Disc Trucker, which is a little more expensive than a Trek 520, for my wife. She loves it. Since she’ll ride it for years I didn’t care about a few hundred dollars.
data.author: Phil Wax

data.text:
https://konaworld.com/sutra_se.cfm
KONA BIKES | DROP BAR / GRAVEL | SUTRA | Sutra SE
konaworld.com
data.author: Michael Shireman

data.text: Buy an 80s Japanese touring bike and install sti shifters... voila.
data.author: Mitchell Paul

data.text: My friend has one and loves it. More a camping tourer than a credit card tourer due to weight but creeps up hills with the triple.
data.author: Jane Hawkins

data.text: I'm happy with mine. The longest tour with it was 4000 mi. No problems.
data.author: Bill Huckabee

data.text: My husband has a Trek 520 and loves it and says it's well worth the money
data.author: Karie Keenan Dirnbauer

data.text: Trek 520 on the Silk Road tough bike
data.author: Frank Denman

data.text: We have done over 20000kms in the last two years on trek 520 including 6 months touring Australia awesome bike strong for heavy loads
data.author: Scott Fowler
Scott Fowler

data.text: My 520 was very reliable, and it handled very well under load, even on fast downhills. Eventually, I gave it away after I came to love riding wider tires (48mm) than that year 2012 model 520 could accommodate.
data.author: David Markun

data.text: The 520 has always had a good reputation, and I bought my 1986 touring bike new. (Edited for typos.)
data.author: Peter Lehman

data.text: I had one I like but the steerer tube had no extra length so if you like an upright position you might struggle.
data.author: Duncan Gray

data.text:
Looking for some info, classific these 4 are the best for me: Cinelli Hobootleg is my, also good Trek 520, Kona Sutra, Salsa Marrakesh. E.g. this is in Italian, the best for travelling. https://www.redbull.com/it-it/migliori-bici-da-cicloturismo
Le 15 migliori bici da cicloturismo del 2021 che vi porteranno lontano
redbull.com
data.author: Johnnie Walker

data.text: VSF Fahrradmanufaktur. I was gonna go with Trek touring-ish bike, but decided at the last min on VSF and couldn't test ride a Trek. No regrets. The entire brand is just made for touring trips of different lengths
data.author: Birgit Le Blond

data.text: Great bikes. Decided to go with the disc trucker over the 520 tho due to the increased load capacity
data.author: Mick Swanson
